description: A leader of the Mexican mural movement, José Clemente Orozco painted this canvas during a self-imposed exile in the United States. Its subject, Emiliano Zapata, was a Mexican revolutionary who fought for liberty and land redistribution for the poor. Here, Orozco placed the revered rebel behind two armed soldiers and two grieving figures—creating not a sense of victory or adulation but of foreboding and ambiguity.
title: Zapata
